channel.title: We have cow killers!
channel.description:
Someone keeps killing the animals, and I'm trying my best so they don't become extinct again. I've stepped up the pressure on those responsible and they lost their bottle and handed the cows back.
It's the newest technique to get revenge on people, I'm unsure if this is against the rules? If someone has secured livestock then I don't see why killing it shouldn't be griefing.

item.title: We have cow killers!
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I assume this program fixes the chunk thing as well, so it’s good to run anyway?

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:429738”]I wouldn’t be doing it every day, it would probably be more than 1 month apart or something.

edit:
But what constitutes ‘your animal’? Sure if it is in a hidden bunker in your basement, but what if I just build a pen around them?[/quote]

As far as I’m concerned, it’s your animal if you’ve clearly marked of that it is your animals. e.g putting walls around it/putting a sign up and declaring it your own.

item.title: We have cow killers!
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Moparisthebest:

It’s too hard to prove and such to make it against the rules isn’t it? I could always just run that program again wiping all the animals like I did last time?

Not to be rude, but you’re not exactly the most consistent activity wise. We’d ask you and by the time you did it everyone would have quit. I have learned my lesson from the past

waits for world map

Si Force:

How do you mean? Don’t cows just spawn again after a while?

Nope, they should do though.

zuppers:

I would agree killing someone’s livestock should be griefing if the rule was more enforceable.

Well for me personally it is enforceable because I design my property in a way that provides clear evidence of anything, so if everyone did it that way the world would be a better place!

Usually people hide animals in secret locations, so if someone kills it it’s usually pretty obvious because they’re the only one who has broken any blocks apart from you. Most people would be frightened and not do it again if it was a rule anyhow.
